questions.text: On what date did "Cheers" first air?
questions.explanation:
September 30, 1982.

	The first episode was entitled "Give Me a Ring Sometime".

questions.text: Ted Danson was not the first person considered for the part of Sam. Which of these people were considered before Ted Danson?
questions.explanation:
Fred Dryer.

	Jay Thomas later played Eddie Lebec. Fred Dryer guest starred as a sports announcer named Dave Richards on an episode called "I on Sports".

questions.text: What is Kelly Gaines' middle name?
questions.explanation:
Susan.

	Kelly Gaines is Woody's girlfriend, and in the last season his wife. She was played by Jackie Swanson. Susan is also the name of Rebecca Howe's sister.

questions.text: How many months did Diane say she would be gone for in the episode where she leaves to go write her book?
questions.explanation:
6.

	Diane Chambers: "I'll be back here. I will. I'll see you in six months."

questions.text: There are three types of women Sam never gets involved with. Which of these four isn't one of those three?
questions.explanation:
Engaged.

	Apparently it used to be only two things, because in one episode Cliff says, "He added one."

questions.text: What is the name of Sam's brother?
questions.explanation:
Derek.

	Derek was played by George Ball.

questions.text: Woody Boyd's middle name is Tiberius.
questions.explanation:
True.

	Woody has the same middle name as Captain Kirk's on "Star Trek".

questions.text: Which cast member played Velma in "Chicago" on Broadway?
questions.explanation:
Bebe Neuwirth.

	Bebe Neuwirth is a wonderful stage actress. She played Lilith on "Cheers" and on "Frasier".

questions.text: During her time on "Cheers", Rhea Perlman was married to __________.
questions.explanation:
Danny DeVito.

	Danny DeVito and Rhea Perlman lived together for 11 years before they were married.  Rhea Perlman played Carla on "Cheers".

questions.text: What does everyone yell when Mr. Peterson walks into the bar?
questions.explanation:
Norm.

	Norm was played by George Wendt.

questions.text: When Lilith goes into labor, Frasier tells her to think of "Gentle loving thoughts," to get through the pain. Which of these was one of her "lovely thoughts"?
questions.explanation:
Demerol.

	Lilith Sternin-Crane: "Novocaine! Codeine! Demerol! Wiskey! Rum! Knock me unconscious with a mallet!"

questions.text: What is the name of Coach's daughter?
questions.explanation:
Lisa.

	Lisa Pantuso was played by Allyce Beasley.

questions.text: Sam sets Diane up with a man named Andy, who was just out of prison. Why was he in prison?
questions.explanation:
murder.

	Andy was played by Derek McGrath.

questions.text: From an episode entitled "Teacher's Pet" what does Albania border on?
questions.explanation:
Adriatic Sea.

	Coach sings: "Albania, Albania you border on the Adriatic."

questions.text: Woody Harrelson replaced Nicholas Colasanto when he died. How did he die?
options: Actually he's not dead, he's with Elvis Presley
questions.explanation:
Heart attack.

	Nicholas Colasanto kept a picture of Geronimo in his dressing room. After he died you could see that picture hanging in the bar on the set of "Cheers".

questions.text: Everyone in the bar goes to the opera with Diane on the episode called "Diane Chambers Day".
questions.explanation:
False.

	Carla does not go.

questions.text: Which of the following people have never kissed Sam?
questions.explanation:
Ester Clavin.

	Ester Clavin is Cliff's mother. Sam and Rebecca have kissed quite often, and even tried to have a baby together. Diane and Sam have also kissed quite often. Woody and Sam were tricked into kissing each other when they held a contest to see who could kiss Rebecca first.

questions.text: Al Rosen, who played Al on "Cheers", was not always credited as Al. In the past he was credited as "The Man Who Said ________".
questions.explanation:
Sinatra.

	In one episode Sam has a dream. In the dream Rebecca takes off her face and it's Al under the Rebecca mask.

questions.text: Which of the following guest star's character has dated Rebecca?
questions.explanation:
Roger Rees.

	Roger Rees played Robin Colcord. She "only loved him for his money."Tom Skerritt played Evan Drake, Rebecca had a crush on him, but they never dated. Tyrone Power Jr. played Nash, Kelly's boyfriend before Woody. Alex Trebec played himself on an episode called "What is Cliff Clavin?".

questions.text: How many times has Carla been married?
questions.explanation:
2.

	She was first married to Nick Tortelli, and then she was married to Eddie LeBec.

questions.text: How many children does Carla have?
questions.explanation:
8.

	They are: Seraphina, Anthony, Ann Marie, Gino, Ludlow, Jesse and Elvis. There's the eighth one too, Lucia. She had the first four with Nick, as well. She had Ludlow with Dr. Ludlow, a friend of Frasier's. She had Jesse and Elvis (twins) with Eddie.

questions.text: Which of these isn't in Carla's full name?
questions.explanation:
Sophia.

	Her full name is Carla Maria Victoria Angelina Teresa Apollonia Lozupone Tortelli LeBec.

questions.text: Shelley Long returned for the 200th episode.
questions.explanation:
True.

	The 200th episode was actually the 202 and 203rd episodes of "Cheers".

questions.text: What is the last line said by Sam in the last episode of "Cheers"?
questions.explanation:
"Sorry we're closed."

	"Cheers" ended after 11 seasons. It had won 27 Emmy Awards during that time.

questions.text: When did the last new episode air?
questions.explanation:
May 20, 1993.

	The last episode was called "One for the Road".
